ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C&C

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Air Support, C&C

SHORT_DESCR.P: All the information contained within this prior information note does not constitute, and should not be construed as, any commitment by the Ministry of Defence (MOD) to proceed with any aspect of this activity beyond the industry day, to be held on 28.2.2018 at RAF College Cranwell. All further activity is strictly subject to further internal MOD approvals. The training solution must provide fully-aerobatic, light flying training aircraft, sufficiently robust to withstand intensive use; flying hours (a total of circa 36 000 hrs per year); aircraft engineering, operations and Motor Transportation (MT) support at 15 operating locations, dispersed throughout the UK and Northern Ireland.

LOT_COMBINING_CONTRACT_RIGHT.P: This is an option that the authority is currently considering.

OBJECT_DESCR.LOT_NO: Lot 1 North, Lot 2 Midlands, Lot 3 South

SHORT_DESCR.P: The training solution must provide fully-aerobatic, light flying training aircraft, sufficiently robust to withstand intensive use; flying hours (a total of circa 36 000 hours per year); aircraft engineering, operations and Motor Transportation (MT) support at 15 operating locations, dispersed throughout the UK and Northern Ireland. Additional requirements will include: Instructor pilot provision (2 sites): Air Traffic Provision (1 site); and limited Soft Facilities Management (3 sites). There is no synthetic flying requirement and theoretical training is required only in support of the respective single service flying Ggading Syllabi for the Royal Navy and Army elements of the task. Contract duration will be 10 years with possible scope for a further 3 option years.

INFO_ADD.P: To help us develop the requirement we will be holding an Industry Day on Wednesday 28.2.2018 at RAF College Cranwell. Start time TBA. Any suppliers who feel they are capable of delivering the training, as briefly described, are welcome to attend. If you are wishing to attend please contact John Harris.

The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.
Advertising Regime OJEU:- This contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU),the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk.
Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your Response Manager and add the following access code: 69TZ96GB48.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the Access code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing support@contracts.mod.uk or Telephone 0800 282 324.
